|stockos = Linux;2.6;; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 6.3 |pwr_barrel_inner = 3.0 |pwr_barrel_len = 12 |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = VDSL2 |addchip = 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;;3; ,,, 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microchip;SST12LP15A;;1; ,,, ADSL2+ AFE/LD;Lantiq;PSB 80190;XWAY, VRX208, PSB 80190, V, V1.1;;1; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.1.254 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = ''randomly generated'' |defaultssid = BTHub5-XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^BTHub5-[A-Z0-9]{4}$ |default_ch = |manuf = Askey |manuf_model = RTV7505W |manuf_rev = -D18 (rev 4.10) |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = OpenWrt |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 10/2013 |estprice = 210 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B00GJ0UBHC |asin_country = GB |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9227;AR9227-BC2A, PPP776.001C, 1318, China; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9880-BR4A;QCA9880-BR4A, NGB639.001C, 1328, KOREA; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== * [http://www.shop.bt.com/products/bt-home-hub-5-90RY.html On the '''BT Shop'''] * [http://bt.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/35298/~/bt-home-hub%2C-bt-voyager-and-connected-devices-gpl-code GPL Code for the ''Home Hub 5''] (and other Home Hub models) The '''Home Hub 5''' is a simultaneous dual-band wireless-AC CPE with an :integrated VDSL2 modem, a GbE WAN port, and four GbE LAN ports. "RTV7505W-D18 (ROHS) REV:4.10" is silkscreened on the board in the [https://community.plus.net/t5/Tech-Help-Software-Hardware-etc/Running-OpenWRT-on-the-Plusnet-Hub-One-amp-BT-Home-Hub-5a/m-p/1302968 images]. :'''HannStar''' seems to be the PCB manufacturer. '''Plusnet''' started shipping an (internally) identical unit in a white case branded :as the ''"[https://community.plus.net/t5/Tech-Help-Software-Hardware-etc/Running-OpenWRT-on-the-Plusnet-Hub-One-amp-BT-Home-Hub-5a/m-p/1302968 Plusnet Hub One]"'' to fibre customers in [http://www.ispreview.co.uk/index.php/2015/11/uk-isp-plusnet-launch-new-hub-one-fibre-router-and-self-install-fttc.html November 2015]. [[BT Home Hub]] *'''BT Home Hub 5 (Type A)''' - CPU: [[Lantiq]] PSB 80910 (XWAY VRX268) *'''[[BT Home Hub 5B|BT Home Hub 5 (Type B)]]''' - CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM63268 @400MHz ===Power consumption=== 
Model		BT Home Hub 5A	BT Home Hub 5B
In operation		9.2W		14.0W
Idle			6.3W		7.2W
Standby mode		0.2W		0.1W
===Specifications=== ====SoC==== *SoC: [[Lantiq]] XWAY VRX268 (PSB 80910 EL V1.2) MIPS 34Kc Per the [http://www.lantiq.com/uploads/media//Lantiq_XWAY-VRX268_Product-Brief.pdf VRX268 product brief], the VRX268 SoC has an internal GbE switch :w/ two internal Ethernet PHYs (each functioning as either a single GbE PHY :or dual FE PHY) and support for three external PHYs via [[wikipedia:Media_Independent_Interface|MII/RMII/RGMII]]. :This unit is using three external GbE PHYs (PEF 7071V) :and the two internal GbE PHYs with the in-SoC switch. The CPU/SoC and both wireless chips are all supported by OpenWrt. ====Wireless==== The wireless radios used are the following... * [[Atheros]] AR9227 - 2T2R 2.4GHz, 802.11bgn (300Mbps) :w/ 2x [http://www.microchip.com/wwwproducts/Devices.aspx?product=SST12LP15A ''Microchip'' SST12LP15A] - High Power 2.4GHz Power Amplifiers :2x internal antnenae, inline Hirose switching coaxial RF test connectors * [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9880 - 3T3R 5GHz, 802.11ac (1.3Gbps)/n (450Mbps) :w/ 3x [[Skyworks]] [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=1504 SE5003L1] - High Power 5GHz Power Amplifiers :3x internal antnenae, inline Hirose switching coaxial RF test connectors. The device has surprisingly long range at 5GHz thanks to the SE5003L1 :high-power amplifiers/front-ends. ==Links of Interest== ===Wikis=== *{{WPLink|BT Home Hub}} *[https://openwrt.org/toh/bt/homehub_v5a ''BT Home Hub 5A'' on '''OpenWrt''' wiki] ===Forum threads=== *[https://community.bt.com/t5/BT-Infinity-Speed-Connection/Bt-homehub-5-event-log/td-p/1057592 ''Event log dump indicating usage of at least one '''QCA''' radio''] *[https://openwrt.ebilan.co.uk/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=266 ''OpenWRTLEDE Installation instructions for Home Hub 5A''] *[http://openwrt.ebilan.co.uk/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=39 ''Serial pin output'' on '''openwrt.ebilan.co.uk'''] *[https://github.com/aszeszo/BTHH5a-fw-mod''How to enable SSH on Home Hub 5A BT stock firmware''] ===Other=== *[http://www.bit-tech.net/news/hardware/2013/07/10/bt-reveals-home-hub-5-with-ac-wi-fi/1 ''BT reveals Home Hub 5 with ac Wi-Fi'' on '''bit-tech.net'''] *[http://www.pocket-lint.com/news/125521-bt-home-hub-5-hands-on-making-bt-infinity-even-better/gallery ''BT Home Hub 5 hands-on: Making BT Infinity even better'' on '''Pocket-lint'''] ===Images=== *[https://openwrt.org/toh/bt/homehub_v5a#pcb_photos PCB Photos on '''OpenWrt''' wiki] *[http://openwrt.ebilan.co.uk/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=21 PCB photos] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/bt/bt_homehub_5_type_a |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/bt/homehub_v5a |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = lantiq |subtarget = xrx200 |arch = mips_24kc |support_started_version = 17.01.0 |current_supported_version = 23.05.3 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here [[Category:English Documentation]]
